author: 13abc
title: Restaurant Report Card: 10.1.15 Sakura
text: TOLEDO (13abc Action News) - If you serve chilled wine, such as Saki, health inspectors say don't keep it in the same ice bin that you use to serve drinks. Instead, keep it in a separate cooler, or it could be a violation. That violations was easily corrected inside Sakura Steakhouse and Sushi Lounge on Monroe St. During the last Standard Health Inspection, Sakura had 11 violations, including 3 critical. Among those violations: No hand soap at the server's hand sink; Heavy build up on stove top and hood; A back hand sink being used as a dump sink. The owner of Sakura did not want to appear on camera, but e walked 13abc through the kitchen so you can see for yourself all of the violations have been corrected. Managers posted a sign above the hand sink which states, "Hand Washing Only." They've also refilled the hand soap and thoroughly cleaned the stove top and hood. The manager points out none of the violations are about the food itself, and that none of the customers were ever at any risk. Here are the restaurants that were violation-free: Sodexo At Brioche Doree 2400 Cherry Street, Toledo (419) 251-3883 Standard Inspection 10-Sep-2015 0 critical & 0 non-critical Subway #6799 401 N Superior Street, Toledo (419) 683-7827 Standard Inspection 29-Aug-2015 0 critical & 0 non-critical Little M Bagel Dba: Barry Bagels 3305 W Central Avenue A2-20, Toledo: (419) 537-9377 Standard Inspection 10-Sep-2015 0 critical & 0 non-critical Jamba Juice 3305 W Central Avenue A2-35, Toledo (419) 724-0721 Standard Inspection 10-Sep-2015 0 critical & 0 non-critical Lam-Pam Enterprises, Inc.
